skt

Class SocketFails

  • java.lang.Object
    • skt.SocketFails

  • public class SocketFails
extends Object
    A container for one set of Message types that fail a Message. This occurs at a SocketInterface level.

    When the SocketInterface receives a Message to be send across the socket, it can automatically reject the Message if a failing Message type is still in the retry buffer.

    Author:
    Kyle
    See Also:
    Message, SocketStream

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      String command
      The received command being checked for automatic rejection.
      ArrayList<String> values
      The other commands that would cause command to fail if any were still in the retry buffer.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SocketFails()
      Creates an empty SocketFails object.
      SocketFails(String command)
      Creates a Socketfails object that fails command.
      SocketFails(String command, ArrayList<String> values)
      Creates a SocketFails object that fails command on any of values.
